node.title: Dominique Morisseau Pulls Play From L.A. Theater, Citing ‘Harm’
node.alt: The playwright Dominique Morisseau halted performances of her play “Paradise Blue” just a week after it opened at the Geffen Playhouse in Los Angeles.
node.description: The playwright ended a run of “Paradise Blue” a week after it opened at the Geffen Playhouse. The theater acknowledged “missteps.”
node.content: ["The playwright Dominique Morisseau has ended the run of her play \u201cParadise Blue\u201d just a week after it opened at the Geffen Playhouse in Los Angeles, saying that Black women who worked on the show had been \u201cverbally abused and diminished.\u201d", "Morisseau did not specifically describe what happened. But in an 1,100-word Facebook post on Wednesday, she said that members of the creative team had been \u201callowed to behave disrespectfully,\u201d that she had demanded an apology from one member of the team and that \u201cinstead of staunchly backing this, the Geffen continued to enable more abuse.\u201d", "\u201cHarm was allowed to fester,\u201d Morisseau said in the Facebook post.", "\u201cI gave the theater an ultimatum,\u201d she added. \u201cRespect the Black womxn artists working on my show, or I will pull my play.\u201d", "In a statement about the cancellation, the Geffen Playhouse said that officials had \u201capologized to everyone involved\u201d and acknowledged having \u201cfallen short\u201d in its commitment to artists.", "\u201cAn incident between members of the production was brought to our attention and we did not respond decisively in addressing it,\u201d the theater\u2019s statement, released on Wednesday, said. \u201cAs a result of these missteps, some members of the production felt unsafe and not fully supported.\u201d", "\u201cParadise Blue,\u201d which is set in 1949, is part of Morisseau\u2019s trilogy of Detroit plays, which have been widely produced at theaters around the country. It played Off Broadway in 2018; the Geffen production had opened to strong reviews on Nov. 18, and had been set to run through Dec. 12.", "\u201cSkeleton Crew,\u201d another play in the trilogy, is scheduled to begin Broadway performances on Dec. 21.", "The theater declined to comment beyond its written statements. Morisseau did not respond to a request for additional comment.", "Morisseau\u2019s decision to pull the play over what she described as the mistreatment of Black artists and the dismissal of their complaints comes as theater continues to grapple with how to reform itself and improve its culture.", "The protests over the police killing of George Floyd in the summer of 2020 ignited a nationwide reckoning over racism and inequality in America that resonated in the theater world. As artists prepared to return from the long pandemic shutdown, some have grown more outspoken about what they say are pervasive problems in the industry.", "This summer Broadway power brokers signed a pact pledging to strengthen the industry\u2019s diversity practices as theaters were preparing to reopen.", "In her Facebook post, Morisseau \u2014 who earned a Tony Award nomination as the book writer for \u201cAin\u2019t Too Proud: The Life and Times of the Temptations\u201d\u2014 said she had been \u201cgutted\u201d by what had transpired with \u201cParadise Blue.\u201d", "She urged the theater industry to \u201clook inward and acknowledge a pervasive culture of anti-blackness, anti-womxness, and anti-black-womxnness.\u201d"]
